DOCNAME: CASE OF YURIY LOBANOV v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions);Pecuniary damage - reserved;Non-pecuniary damage - claim dismissed (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage)
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant is a holder of DATE ORG premium loan bonds ( облигации Государственного внутреннего выигрышного займа DATE года ) having a total nominal value of CARDINAL “ promissory roubles ” ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE , the GPE issued a ORG internal premium loan to finance certain ORG programmes ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . According to the conditions of the loan , individuals could invest their money in ORG premium bonds and redeem them at any time during the term of the loan with interest at MONEY per annum . The term of the loan was fixed at DATE . In that period , CARDINAL ORG - organised draws were to be held in which some bonds would win cash prizes .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE , the Government of GPE acknowledged its succession in respect of the obligations of the GPE under the DATE loan and suspended payments under the DATE ORG premium bonds ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . DATE , a series of NORP laws was adopted which provided for conversion of NORP securities , including the DATE loan bonds , into special NORP promissory notes ( see paragraphs CARDINAL below ) . The Government was mandated to devise a procedure for the conversion and fix the value of the promissory notes . Although a regulation on the conversion was adopted in DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , the actual conversion did not start and application of the regulation has remained suspended to the present day ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE , the applicant wrote to ORG to inquire about possibilities and time - limits for converting his DATE bonds into NORP promissory notes . By a letter of DATE , a deputy director of ORG confirmed to the applicant that his bonds should be converted into the NORP promissory notes in accordance with LAW . The deputy director went on to explain why the conversion had not yet been possible :

“ Section CARDINAL of the [ LAW provides that the procedure for calculating the interest accrued on the NORP promissory notes and the procedure for servicing the [ internal ] debt would be set out in a special federal law , which has not yet been enacted . In this connection , actual payments in [ NORP ] roubles under the promissory notes – as provided in the [ LAW – can not be made and the determination of the value of the [ ' promissory rouble ' ] would be of no practical significance since its application has not yet been defined by the legislator .

Once the legislation on the procedure for calculating the interest and the debt - servicing procedure has been adopted , ORG will make the necessary arrangements for the conversion of GPE securities ... into promissory notes and the servicing of them ; it will also launch an open tender for selection of the conversion agent ... ”
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant brought proceedings before ORG of the Russian Federation challenging the Government for inactivity and failure to put the redemption programme into effect .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to examine the applicant 's claim . It found as follows :

“ By virtue of the constitutional principle of separation of powers , the court may not , in civil proceedings , require the Government of GPE to enact a specific legal act if the law does not explicitly set out the duty of the Government to adopt appropriate regulation ; the claim may not be accepted for examination by the court . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG approved , by ORG no . CARDINAL , the issue of bonds of the DATE ORG premium internal loan having nominal values of CARDINAL , DATE and MONEY . Their period of circulation was set at DATE , from DATE to DATE . NORP citizens could either buy the DATE bonds with their own money or obtain them in exchange for bonds from the DATE ORG premium internal loan . The DATE bonds could be sold and redeemed throughout the entire period of circulation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Government of ORG no . CARDINAL concerning the DATE ORG internal premium loan and a new NORP internal premium loan to be issued in DATE . It provided as follows :
“ CARDINAL . To confirm succession of the Government of GPE in respect of obligations of the former GPE to GPE citizens arising out of the bonds of the DATE ORG internal premium loan .
CARDINAL . NORP Starting from DATE , to discontinue sale and purchase of bonds of that loan and holding of prize draws .
CARDINAL . To issue the DATE NORP internal premium loan .

CARDINAL . To give GPE citizens who are holders of bonds of the DATE ORG internal premium loan the right to voluntary exchange of the bonds against ORG securities , including DATE NORP internal premium loan bonds , shares in ORG of GPE , and also to credit the proceeds from sale of bonds to deposits open in ORG of GPE , from DATE ... ”

CARDINAL . By Resolution no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , ORG decided that from DATE to CARDINAL DATE ORG would be authorised to purchase DATE bonds and exchange them for DATE bonds at the rate of MONEY for CARDINAL bond with a nominal value of MONEY .

CARDINAL . On DATE LAW ( no . CARDINAL-FZ , ФЗ « О восстановлении и защите сбережений граждан Российской PERSON ) was enacted . The ORG guaranteed the protection of NORP citizens ' savings , including their investments in ORG securities issued by the GPE and ORG before DATE ( section CARDINAL ) . Guaranteed savings were recognised as part of the internal ORG debt of GPE secured with the entirety of the assets available at the disposal of the Government of GPE ( sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) . NORP securities were to be converted into special promissory notes of GPE with a special promissory value ( sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) . Separate laws were to be enacted to determine the procedure for converting NORP securities into NORP promissory notes and to determine their current value ( section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Promissory Value Act ( no . CARDINAL-FZ , ФЗ « О порядке установления долговой стоимости единицы номинала целевого долгового обязательства Российской PERSON ) introduced the “ promissory rouble ” as the currency of special promissory notes of GPE ( section CARDINAL ) . The actual value of the “ promissory rouble ” was to be determined as a proportion of the “ control value ” of the consumer goods basket and its “ base value ” at the prices that prevailed in the RSFSR in DATE ( section CARDINAL ) . The “ control value ” was to be calculated on a DATE basis by ORG and the “ base value ” was to be fixed in a federal law ( sections DATE ) . The Government was to publish the current value of the “ promissory rouble ” within DATE of the Act 's coming into force .

Its application was suspended from DATE to CARDINAL DATE by successive federal laws ( no . CARDINAL of DATE , no . CARDINAL of DATE , no . CARDINAL of DATE , no . CARDINAL of DATE , no . CARDINAL of DATE , no . CARDINAL of DATE , and no . CARDINAL-FZ of DATE ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG approved guidelines on calculation of the “ control value ” ( resolution no . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE LAW ( no . CARDINAL-FZ , ФЗ « О порядке перевода государственных ценных бумаг ORG и сертификатов Сберегательного банка ORG в целевые долговые обязательства Российской PERSON ) confirmed that bonds of the DATE ORG internal premium loan which are still in circulation in GPE are part of the guaranteed savings of NORP citizens ( section CARDINAL ) . Sections CARDINAL to CARDINAL set out the general principles for conversion of the bonds into special promissory notes of GPE . The debt servicing procedure was to be governed by a separate federal law ( section CARDINAL ) . LAW specified that the guarantees of LAW were fully applicable to securities which had not been converted into NORP promissory notes and that no statute of limitation applied to claims arising out of those securities .

CARDINAL . In pursuance of section CARDINAL of LAW , on DATE ORG approved a regulation on the procedure for conversion of GPE securities into NORP promissory notes ( Resolution no . CARDINAL ) . It set out that conversion into promissory notes would be performed by putting a stamp on the face of the bonds , which would certify the fact of conversion and also the nature , face value and interest rate of the new promissory note ( paragraph CARDINAL ) . Converted bonds were to be entered into a register maintained by ORG ( paragraph CARDINAL ) . The conversion was to be carried out by a designated lending agency , which ORG was to choose by tender ( section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of the GPE ORG quashed , by way of supervisory review , all the judgments in a civil case in which the claimants sued ORG for their failure to determine the value of the “ promissory rouble ” ( decision no . CARDINAL ) . It held as follows :

“ The claims raised by PERSON and PERSON outside the courts ' competence ; a court may not encroach on the competence of the executive body by requiring it to perform actions or to issue regulations which are within the competence of that body . The court may only ... assess the compliance of the Government regulations with NORP federal legislation . Besides , district courts have no competence over such claims . Pursuant to LAW , a court shall discontinue the proceedings if the claim may not be examined and determined in civil proceedings . ”
